name: RDE/BRDA Deposit Generation
description: An Apache Beam pipeline generates RDE or BRDA deposits and deposits them to GCS with GhostRyde encryption.

parameters.name: jpaTransactionManagerType
parameters.label: The type of JPA transaction manager to use
parameters.helpText: The standard SQL instance or a read-only replica may be used

parameters.name: pendings
parameters.label: The pendings deposits to generate.
parameters.helpText: A TLD to PendingDeposit map that is serialized and Base64 URL-safe encoded.

parameters.name: validationMode
parameters.label: How strict the marshaller validates the given EPP resources.
parameters.helpText: If set to LENIENT the marshaller will not warn about missing data on the EPP resources.

parameters.name: rdeStagingBucket
parameters.label: The GCS bucket that where the resulting files will be stored.
parameters.helpText: Only the bucket name itself, without the leading "gs://".

parameters.name: stagingKey
parameters.label: The PGP public key used to encrypt the RDE/BRDA deposit files.
parameters.helpText: The key is Base64 URL-safe encoded.

parameters.name: workerMachineType
parameters.label: The GCE machine type for the dataflow job workers.

parameters.name: usePublicIps
parameters.label: Whether the GCE workers are assigned public IPs
parameters.helpText: Public IPs have an associated cost and there's a quota per region on the total number of public IPs assigned at a given time. If the service only needs to access GCP APIs, it's better to not use public IP, but one needs to configure the network accordingly. See https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/routes-firewall.
